.'' Gbagbo's camp has dismissed Alassane Ouattara 's export ban as unenforceable. Spokesman Ahoua Don Mello says the reality is that cocoa shipments continue.`` Every day cocoa is being shipped out,'' he says. Trying to cripple Ivory Coast economically is not possible. Cocoa exports will continue. Coffee too and rubber- because it's the foreigners themselves who need them. An estimated seven million people live off cocoa in Ivory Coast.
